laazotea.indi.client

Class INDIDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.client.INDIDevice

  • public class INDIDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a INDI Device.
    Version:
    1.32, January 27, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

      • INDIDevice

        protected INDIDevice(java.lang.String name,
          INDIServerConnection server)
        Constructs an instance of INDIDevice. Usually called from a INDIServerConnection.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this Device
        server - the Server Connection of this Device
        See Also:
        INDIServerConnection

      • BLOBsEnable

        public void BLOBsEnable(laazotea.indi.Constants.BLOBEnables enable)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the appropriate message to the Server to establish a particular BLOB policy (BLOBEnable) for the Device.
        Parameters:
        enable - The BLOB policy.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem sending the message.

               INDIProperty property)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the appropriate message to the Server to establish a particular BLOB policy (BLOBEnable) for the Device and a particular Property.
        Parameters:
        enable - The BLOB policy.
        property - The Property of the Device to listen to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem sending the message.

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)

        Parameters:

      • deleteProperty

        protected void deleteProperty(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
        Processes a XML <delProperty>. It removes the appropriate Property from the list of Properties.
        Parameters:
        xml - the XML message to be processed.

      • waitForProperty

        public INDIProperty waitForProperty(java.lang.String name)
        This function waits until a Property with a name exists in this device and returns it. The wait is dinamic, so it should be called from a different Thread or the app will freeze until the property exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Property to wait for.
        Returns:
        The Property once it exists in this device.

      • waitForProperty

        public INDIProperty waitForProperty(java.lang.String name,
                           int maxWait)
        This function waits until a Property with a name exists in this device and returns it. The wait is dinamic, so it should be called from a different Thread or the app will freeze until the property exists or the maxWait number of seconds have elapsed.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Property to wait for.
        maxWait - Maximum number of seconds to wait for the Property
        Returns:
        The Property once it exists in this Device or null if the maximum wait is achieved.

      • updateProperty

        protected void updateProperty(org.w3c.dom.Element xml)
        Processes a XML <setXXXVector>. It updates the appropiate Property.
        Parameters:
        xml - the XML message to be processed.

        Processes a XML <newXXXVector>. It creates and adds the appropiate Property.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML message to be processed.

      • getElement

        public INDIElement getElement(java.lang.String propertyName,
                     java.lang.String elementName)
        A convenience method to get the Element of a Property by specifiying their names.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the Property.
        elementName - the name of the Element.
        Returns:
        the Element with elementName as name of the property with propertyName as name.

      • sendMessageToServer

        protected void sendMessageToServer(java.lang.String XMLMessage)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a XML message to the Server.
        Parameters:
        XMLMessage - the message to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the connection to the server.

      • getDefaultUIComponent

        public INDIDeviceListener getDefaultUIComponent()
                                         throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Gets a default UI component to handle the repesentation and control of this Device. The panel is registered as a listener of this Device. Please note that the UI class must implement INDIDeviceListener. The component will be chosen depending on the loaded UI libraries (I4JClientUI, I4JAndroid, etc). Note that a casting of the returned value must be done. If a previous component has been asked, it will be dregistered as a listener. So, only one default component will listen to the device.
        Returns:
        A UI component that handles this Device.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException - if no UIComponent is found in the classpath.

      • getPropertiesAsList

        public java.util.List<INDIProperty> getPropertiesAsList()
        Gets a List with all the Properties of this Device.
        Returns:
        the List of Properties belonging to this Device.

      • getPropertyNames

        public java.lang.String[] getPropertyNames()
        Gets the names of the Properties of this Device.
        Returns:
